ProductList.Description: Premium chicken breasts are smothered in an authentic Thai sauce, made with red curry, coconut milk, edamame, and shiitake mushrooms. The rich complex flavors have a little kick of spice, without too much heat.
ProductList.FullDescription:
PREPARATION

Conventional Oven: Cook from frozen. Pre heat oven to 375. Peel open pouch and place the chicken breast seared side up, into a small baking pan. Use a spoon to scoop out the remaining sauce from the pouch and place it on the chicken. Bake for 50-60 minutes from frozen or bake for 30-40 minutes from thawed. Carefully take the baking pan out of the oven and serve. Oven temperatures vary adjust accordingly.
Microwave Preparation: Peel open pouch and place the chicken in a microwave safe container. Discard plastic pouch. Place a paper towel on top of container. Microwave on high for 6 -8 minutes from frozen or 2-3 minutes from thawed. Carefully remove the container from the microwave and let stand for 1 minute before serving.

INGREDIENTS

Chicken Breast, Coconut Milk (coconut milk, water, guar gum and sodium carboxy methyl cellulose, polysorbate 60, sodium metabisulfite), Water, Edamame (shelled soybean), Shallots, Dark Brown Sugar, Red Curry Paste (red chili pepper, garlic, soybean oil, lemongrass, galangal, salt, shallot, spices, kaffir lime), Vegetable Oil (canola oil, extra virgin olive oil), Tamarind Concentrate (tamarind fruit, water, natural corn starch), Shiitake Mushrooms (contains sulfites), Fish Sauce (anchovy extract, salt, sugar), Lime Juice, Basil, Salt, Modified Corn Starch, Paprika, White Pepper, Xanthan Gum

ProductList.Description: Enjoy this authentic Asian favorite. Each potsticker is loaded with a delicious mixture of chicken and vegetables. Easily prepared in a variety of ways, you will want to be sure to keep these on hand.
ProductList.FullDescription:
PREPARATION

Pan Frying: Heat 1 1/2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in non-stick frying pan to medium heat. Place frozen potstickers in the frying pan. Cook until bottom of potstickers are slightly brown. Add cold water into the frying pan to cover 1/4 of potstickers height. Cover frying pan and cook in high heat. Turn to medium heat when most of the water has evaporated. Continue to cook until all the water has evaporated and the bottom of the potstickers are golden brown.
Steaming: Boil water in steam cooker. Line the steamer with cabbage or lettuce leaves. Place the frozen potstickers in the steamer on top of the leaves. Cover steamer and cook for approximately 15 minutes, until potstickers are done.
Microwave Preparation: Cover 10 potstickers loosely with wet paper towel and heat on high for 2 minutes. Turn the potstickers over and heat for an additional 2 minutes. Potstickers will be heated through, but not browned.

INGREDIENTS

Filling: cabbage, chicken, sesame seed oil, onion, soy sauce (water, wheat, soybean, salt), salt, soybean oil, sugar, spices, garlic. Wrapper: unbleached wheat four enriched (niacin, reduced iron, thiamine mononitrate, ribloflavin, folic acid), water, food starch, salt, soybean oil.

ALLERGY ALERT

CONTAINS: WHEAT, SOY, SESAME
 

NUTRITIONAL INFORMATION

Conventional Oven: Set oven temperature to 375F. Lightly grease oven safe tray and evenly place salmon burgers. Place tray in the center of the oven and cook for appoximately 5 minutes or until desired. 
Stove Top: Set stove top to medium/high heat. Lightly oil a medium size saute' pan and evenly place salmon burgers. Cook burgers for approximately 2-3 minutes per side or until desired.
Microwave Preparation: Not recommended.
*Note: All cooking instructions are only meant to use as a guide as all grills, ovens and stove tops vary in temperature.

Salmon, Cream Cheese (pasteurized cultured milk and cream, salt, stabilizers [xanthan and/or carob bean and/or quar]), Sun Dried Tomato (sundried tomatoes, salt, sulfur dioxide, glucose, citric acid), Panko Bread Crumbs (bleached wheat flour, dextrose, yeast, salt), Basil, Salt, Onion Powder, Lemon Puree, Garlic Powder, White Pepper.

ProductList.Description: The base of this heart-warming dessert is French bread, cream, butter, and eggs; but what makes it truly decadent is the chocolate ganache sauce you drizzle over top when it comes out of the oven. No one will suspect that it wasn't homemade!
ProductList.FullDescription:
PREPARATION
Conventional Oven: Preheat oven to 350. Remove bread pudding from plastic wrap. Place bread pudding (still in tray) on a baking sheet and heat in oven for 30-40 minutes. Boil 2 quarts of water in a pot (rolling boil). Add chocolate sauce packet to boiling water and reduce heat to simmer. Simmer sauce for 3-4 minutes. Drizzle sauce over bread pudding and serve.
Microwave Preparation: Remove bread pudding tray from plastic wrap. Microwave the bread pudding on high for 12-14 minutes. Cut small hole in the chocolate sauce packet. Place sauce packet in a microwavable cup to prevent spilling. Microwave the sauce for 1-2 minutes. Drizzle sauce over bread pudding and serve.

 

INGREDIENTS:

Bread Pudding: Cream, French Bread, (enriched flour [wheat flour, malted barley flour, niacin, ferrous sulfate, thiamin mononitrate, ribloflavin, folic acid], water, yeast, contains less than 2% of the following: high fructose corn syrup, salt, soybean oil, calcium propionate [preservative], xanthan gum, baking soda, sodium aluminum phosphate, corn starch, dough conditioners [datem, ammonium sulfate, calcium sulfate, ascorbic acid, enzymes, potassium iodate, azodicarbonamide, l-cystein hydrochloride, vital wheat gluten]),semi-sweet chocolate (sugar, chocolate, cocoa butter, milkfat, soy lecithin., natural flavors), eggs (whole eggs, citric acid [to preserve color], xanthan gum), sugar, vanilla butter. Chocolate Ganache Sauce: Semi-sweet chocolate (sugar, chocolate, cocoa butter, milkfat, soy lecithin, natural flavors) cream, butter.

ALLERGY ALERT

CONTAINS: EGG, MILK, SOY, WHEAT
 

NUTRITIONAL INFORMATION

Nutrition Facts (per serving): Calories 410, Calories from fat 260, Total fat 28g (43% DV), Saturated fat 17g (85% DV), Cholesterol 105mg (35% DV), Sodium 190mg (8% DV), Total carbohydrates 39g (13% DV), Fiber 2g (8% DV), Sugars 23g, Protein 6g

ProductList.Description: This version of our top-selling potstickers is loaded with a tasty mixture of pork, vegetables and Asian flavorings. Heat by steamer, stovetop, or microwave and enjoy as a snack or meal in a matter of minutes.
ProductList.FullDescription:
PREPARATION

Pan Frying: Heat 1 1/2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in non-stick frying pan to medium heat. Place frozen potstickers in the frying pan. Cook until bottom of potstickers are slightly brown. Add cold water into the frying pan to cover 1/4 of potstickers height. Cover frying pan and cook in high heat. Turn to medium heat when most of the water has evaporated. Continue to cook until all the water has evaporated and the bottom of the potstickers are golden brown.
Steaming: Boil water in steam cooker. Line the steamer with cabbage or lettuce leaves. Place the frozen potstickers in the steamer on top of the leaves. Cover steamer and cook for approximately 15 minutes, until potstickers are done.
Microwave Preparation: Cover 10 potstickers loosely with wet paper towel and heat on high for 2 minutes. Turn the potstickers over and heat for an additional 2 minutes. Potstickers will be heated through, but not browned.

INGREDIENTS

Filling: Cabbage, Pork, sesame seed oil, onion, soy sauce (water, wheat, soybean, salt), salt, spices, sugar, garlic. Wrapper: unbleached wheat flour enriched (niacin, reduced iron, thiamine mononitrate, ribloflavin, folic acid), water, food starch, salt.

ALLERGY ALERT

CONTAINS: WHEAT, SOY, SESAME
 

NUTRITIONAL INFORMATION

ProductList.Description: Soft, hand-twisted pretzels are topped with succulent crab meat and a seasoned blend of cheddar and cream cheese. Enjoy this gourmet treat with a nice, cold beer!
ProductList.FullDescription:
PREPARATION

Conventional Oven: Thaw under refrigeration for 1 hour. Preheat oven to 350 degrees. Arrange pretzels on a lined baking sheet. Bake for approximately 10 to 12 minutes until cheese fully melts. Oven temperatures vary, adjust accordingly.*
*Cook until internal temperature is 165 F for at least 30 seconds.
INGREDIENTS: Pretzel: Enriched wheat flour (wheat flour, malted barley flour, niacin, reduced iron, thiamine mononitrate, ribloflavin, folic acid), water, corn syrup, yeast, salt, bicarbonates and carbonates of soda. ProductList.Description: Enjoy this authentic Asian favorite. Each potsticker is loaded with a mixture of chicken or pork, vegetables and Asian flavorings. Just saute, steam or microwave.You will see why these are our top selling items.Includes 40 pork and 40 chicken potstickers.
ProductList.FullDescription:
PREPARATION

Pan Frying: Heat 1 1/2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in non-stick frying pan to medium heat. Place frozen potstickers in the frying pan. Cook until bottom of potstickers are slightly brown. Add cold water into the frying pan to cover 1/4 of potstickers height. Cover frying pan and cook in high heat. Turn to medium heat when most of the water has evaporated. Continue to cook until all the water has evaporated and the bottom of the potstickers are golden brown.
Steaming: Boil water in steam cooker. Line the steamer with cabbage or lettuce leaves. Place the frozen potstickers in the steamer on top of the leaves. Cover steamer and cook for approximately 15 minutes, until potstickers are done.
Microwave Preparation: Cover 10 potstickers loosely with wet paper towel and heat on high for 2 minutes. Turn the potstickers over and heat for an additional 2 minutes. Potstickers will be heated through, but not browned.

INGREDIENTS

Pork Potsticker

Filling: Cabbage, Pork, sesame seed oil, onion, soy sauce (water, wheat, soybean, salt), salt, spices, sugar, garlic. Wrapper: unbleached wheat flour enriched (niacin, reduced iron, thiamine mononitrate, ribloflavin, folic acid), water, food starch, salt.
 
Chicken Potsticker
  Filling: cabbage, chicken, sesame seed oil, onion, soy sauce (water, wheat, soybean, salt), salt, soybean oil, sugar, spices, garlic. Wrapper: unbleached wheat four enriched (niacin, reduced iron, thiamine mononitrate, ribloflavin, folic acid), water, food starch, salt, soybean oil.

ALLERGY ALERT

CONTAINS: WHEAT, SOY, SESAME
 

NUTRITIONAL INFORMATION

Pork Potsticker
Nutrition facts (per serving) 5 Potstickers: Calories 190, Calories from fat 45, Total fat 5g (8% DV), Saturated fat 1.5g (7% DV), Cholesteral 15mg (5% DV), Sodium 480mg (20% DV), Total carbohydrates 28g (9% DV), Fiber 1g (6% DV), Sugars 2g, Protein 8g
 
Chicken Potsticker
Nutrition Facts (per serving) 6 Potstickers: Calories 180, Calories from fat 30, Total fat 3g (5% DV), Saturated fat .5g (3% DV), Cholesteral 20mg (7% DV), Sodium 560mg (23% DV), Total carbohydrates 27g (9% DV), Fiber 2g (8% DV), Sugars 2g, Protein 10g.

ProductList.Description: A breast of chicken in a spiced red curry coconut sauce. Edamame and shiitake mushrooms add to this exotic entrée.
ProductList.FullDescription:
PREPARATION

Conventional Oven: Cook from frozen. Pre heat oven to 375. Peel open pouch and place the chicken breast seared side up, into a small baking pan. Use a spoon to scoop out the remaining sauce from the pouch and place it on the chicken. Heat for 20-24 minutes. Carefully take the baking pan out of the oven and serve. Oven temperatures vary adjust accordingly.
Microwave Preparation: Peel open pouch and place the chicken in a microwave safe container. Discard plastic pouch. Place a paper towel on top of container. Microwave on high for 3 to 3 1/2 minutes from frozen. Carefully remove the container from the microwave and let stand for 1 minute before serving.

INGREDIENTS

Chicken Breast, Coconut Milk (coconut milk, water, guar gum and sodium carboxy methyl cellulose, polysorbate 60, sodium metabisulfite), Water, Edamame (shelled soybean), Shallots, Dark Brown Sugar, Red Curry Paste (red chili pepper, garlic, soybean oil, lemongrass, galangal, salt, shallot, spices, kaffir lime), Vegetable Oil (canola oil, extra virgin olive oil), Tamarind Concentrate (tamarind fruit, water, natural corn starch), Shiitake Mushrooms (contains sulfites), Fish Sauce (anchovy extract, salt, sugar), Lime Juice, Basil, Salt, Modified Corn Starch, Paprika, White Pepper, Xanthan Gum

ProductList.Description: Enjoy our vegetarian version of an Asian favorite. Each potsticker is filled with a mixture of cabbage, baked tofu, carrots, onions, green beans,peas,soy, sesame oil, garlic and spices. All of this goodness is then surrounded in a light wrapper.
ProductList.FullDescription:
PREPARATION

Pan Frying: Heat 1 1/2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in non-stick frying pan to medium heat. Place frozen potstickers in the frying pan. Cook until bottom of potstickers are slightly brown. Add cold water into the frying pan to cover 1/4 of potstickers height. Cover frying pan and cook in high heat. Turn to medium heat when most of the water has evaporated. Continue to cook until all the water has evaporated and the bottom of the potstickers are golden brown.
Steaming: Boil water in steam cooker. Line the steamer with cabbage or lettuce leaves. Place the frozen potstickers in the steamer on top of the leaves. Cover steamer and cook for approximately 15 minutes, until potstickers are done.
Microwave Preparation: Cover 10 potstickers loosely with wet paper towel and heat on high for 2 minutes. Turn the potstickers over and heat for an additional 2 minutes. Potstickers will be heated through, but not browned.

INGREDIENTS

Filling: cabbage, baked tofu, vermicelli (green beans, peas), carrots, red cabbage, soy sauce (water, soybeans, wheat, salt), modified food starch, onion, sugar, salt, soybean oil, garlic, xanthan gum, sesame seed oil, and spices. Wrapper: unbleached wheat four enriched (niacin, reduced iron, thiamine mononitrate, ribloflavin, folic acid), water, food starch, salt, soybean oil.

ALLERGY ALERT

CONTAINS: WHEAT, SOY, SESAME
 

NUTRITIONAL INFORMATION

ProductList.Description: A lovely vegetarian alternative to our original potstickers, these contain a seasoned mixture of edamame, carrots, and cabbage. As easy to prepare as they are delicious, and perfect for entertaining or a quick and easy meal!
ProductList.FullDescription:
PREPARATION

Pan Frying: Heat 1 1/2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in non-stick frying pan to medium heat. Place frozen potstickers in the frying pan. Cook until bottom of potstickers are slightly brown. Add cold water into the frying pan to cover 1/4 of potstickers height. Cover frying pan and cook in high heat. Turn to medium heat when most of the water has evaporated. Continue to cook until all the water has evaporated and the bottom of the potstickers are golden brown. 
Steaming: Boil water in steam cooker. Line the steamer with cabbage or lettuce leaves. Place the frozen potstickers in the steamer on top of the leaves. Cover steamer and cook for approximately 15 minutes, until potstickers are done.
Microwave Preparation: Cover 10 potstickers loosely with wet paper towel and heat on high for 2 minutes. Turn the potstickers over and heat for an additional 2 minutes. Potstickers will be heated through, but not browned.

INGREDIENTS

Filling: Cabbage, edamame (young soybeans), vermicelli (green beans, peas), carrots, soy sauce (water, soybeans,wheat, salt), modified food starch, onion, sugar, yeast extract, salt, soybean oil, garlic, black pepper. Wrapper: Unbleached wheat four enriched (niacin, reduced iron, thiamine mononitrate, ribloflavin, folic acid), water, food starch, salt, soybean oil.

ALLERGY ALERT

CONTAINS: WHEAT,  SESAME
 

NUTRITIONAL INFORMATION

ProductList.Description: These large shell-on shrimp are prepared with a rich, buttery scampi sauce. Quick and easy to prepare, but guaranteed to impress your guests and delight every palate. We recommend serving it with a loaf of bread for soaking up and savoring every drop.
ProductList.FullDescription:
PREPARATION Do not thaw. 

Skillet Instructions: Preheat skillet over medium heat. Place frozen shrimp in a single layer and saute on each side 4 - 5 minutes until thorughly cooked. Place a lid on top of skillet for faster results.
Grill Instructions: Item is butter glazed, do not place directly on open flames or grill. Place frozen glazed shrimp on aluminum foil (fold sides up to catch liquid), cook over medium low heat for 8 - 12 minutes, turning frequently. For added flavor baste with sauce while cooking. 
Baking Instructions: Place frozen shrimp in a single layer in oven safe casserole dish. Bake in a preheated 375 oven for 14-18 minutes. Turn frequently and baste with sauce during cooking.

ProductList.FullDescription:
Preparation

Conventional Oven: Cook from frozen. Preheat oven to 375. Remove from packaging and place frozen shrimp and orzo in oven safe casserole dish, place on center rack of oven and cook 20 minutes, stir and cook an additional 15 minutes or until cooked throughly. Let rest prior to serving.

Skillet/Pan Saute: From frozen. Remove from package and place frozen shrimp and orzo in a preheated low to medium heated skillet and cover. Cook for 3 minutes, stir and turn shrimp over, continue to cook an additional 3-4 minutes. Until shrimp are opaque. Let stand prior to serving.
*Equipment temperatures vary, adjust cook times accordingly.
 

Ingredients: Orzo (wheat flour, water, B vitamins, iron), shrimp, cream, alfredo sauce (water, half and half [milk, cream, non fat milk solids], Parmesan Cheese [pasteurized part-skim cow's milk and/or sheep's milk, cheese cultures, salt enzymes and powdered cellulose to prevent caking], cream base [partially hydrogenated soybean and corn oils, modified food starch, whey powder, corn syrup solids, maltodextrin, salt, monosodium glutamate, sugar, sodium caseinate, dipotassium phosphate, xanthan gum, mono & diglycerides, cooked chicken meat, sodium stearoyl lactylate, carrageenan, onion powder, spice, garlic powder, color {turmeric, annatto, beta carotene, caramel color, yellow #6}, and less than 2 % silicon dioxide added to prevent caking], unsalted butter [cream, natural flavorings)], granulated garlic, pasteurized lemon juice, salt, titanium dioxide, gum stabilizer [gum arabic, xantham gum, carrageenan], natural cheese flavor [maltodextrin, whey solids, natural Parmesan cheese flavor, salt] white pepper, parsley flakes), palm oil, grasted Parmesan cheese (pasteurized skim milk, cheese cultures, salt, enzymes), powdered milk, soy lecithin, sodium tripolyphosphate (to retain moisture), sodium bisulfate (as a preservative)

ProductList.Description: Delicate wonton wrappers are filled with tender pork permeated by soy and hoisin sauce. The result is a subtly sweet potsticker with a kick!
ProductList.FullDescription:
PREPARATION

Pan Frying: Heat 1 1/2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in non-stick frying pan to medium heat. Place frozen potstickers in the frying pan. Cook until bottom of potstickers are slightly brown. Add cold water into the frying pan to cover 1/4 of potstickers height. Cover frying pan and cook in high heat. Turn to medium heat when most of the water has evaporated. Continue to cook until all the water has evaporated and the bottom of the potstickers are golden brown. 
Steaming: Boil water in steam cooker. Line the steamer with cabbage or lettuce leaves. Place the frozen potstickers in the steamer on top of the leaves. Cover steamer and cook for approximately 15 minutes, until potstickers are done.
Microwave Preparation: Cover 10 potstickers loosely with wet paper towel and heat on high for 2 minutes. Turn the potstickers over and heat for an additional 2 minutes. Potstickers will be heated through, but not browned.

INGREDIENTS

Filling: Pork, water, sugar, soy sauce (water, soybeans, wheat, salt), dark soy sauce (water, soybeans, sugar, salt, wheat flour, sulfur dioxide), hoisin sauce (sugar, water, soybeans, salt, oyster extractives [oyster, water, salt], modified corn starch, caramel), hoisin sauce (sugar, water, soybeans, salt, sweet potato, modified corn starch, sesame seeds, garlic, wheat flour, chili pepper, spices, caramel color, acetic acid, FD&C Red color no 40,) modified food strach, monosodium glutamate, black pepper, salt, Wrapper: Unbleached enriched wheat flour (niacin, reduced iron, thiamine mononitrate, riboflavin, folic acid), water, corn starch, salt, soybean oil.

ProductList.Description: Enjoy the symphony of flavors in this satisfying potsticker variety. To create this masterful selection, we combine the rich, earthy taste of shittake mushrooms, with the tang of soy sauce and a hint of garlic. All wrapped up in a delicate Asian dumpling.
ProductList.FullDescription:
PREPARATION

Pan Frying: Heat 1 1/2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in non-stick frying pan to medium heat. Place frozen potstickers in the frying pan. Cook until bottom of potstickers are slightly brown. Add cold water into the frying pan to cover 1/4 of potstickers height. Cover frying pan and cook in high heat. Turn to medium heat when most of the water has evaporated. Continue to cook until all the water has evaporated and the bottom of the potstickers are golden brown. 
Steaming: Boil water in steam cooker. Line the steamer with cabbage or lettuce leaves. Place the frozen potstickers in the steamer on top of the leaves. Cover steamer and cook for approximately 15 minutes, until potstickers are done.
Microwave Preparation: Cover 10 potstickers loosely with wet paper towel and heat on high for 2 minutes. Turn the potstickers over and heat for an additional 2 minutes. Potstickers will be heated through, but not browned.

INGREDIENTS

Filling: Shitake Mushroom, soy sauce (water, soybeans, wheat, salt), modified food starch, sugar, soybean oil, salt, yeast extract, garlic, sesame seed oil, black pepper.

ALLERGY ALERT

CONTAINS: WHEAT,  SESAME, SOY

Microwave Preparation: Peel open pouch and place the chicken in a microwave safe container. Discard plastic pouch. Place a paper towel on top of container.
